newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil ends off highs, tone remains firm.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil ends off highs, tone remains firm.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES - Late profit-taking and selling emerged and prices closed off day's highs. Earlier gains reflected shortcovering and a technical rebound. Market trend depends on the performance of the soyoil futures market. July futures contract seen trading in 1,250-1,280 range.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL - Followed the futures market and interest was seen widespread in crude palm oil and RBD palm olein.
Traders said a lack of follow-through buying prompted the afternoon fall, though some said the upside potential was still intact.

The July futures contract closed 13 ringgit higher at 1,270 ringgit ($508.51) a tonne after trading between 1,259 and 1,279 ringgit. A chartist said the contract is expected to trade between 1,250 and 1,280.
Technically, the market is uncertain and the trend on Thursday would depend on the Chicago soyoil performance tonight, traders said.
Traders attributed the earlier gains to a technical rebound after prices had fallen on Tuesday.
Physicals April (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,350 ringgit against bids of 1,347.50 after trading from 1,350 to 1,347.50.
April (central) saw offers at 1,330 and bids at 1,320 with earlier trades done at 1,320 and 1,325.
May (south) was offered at 1,350 and bids at 1,347.50 with trades done from 1,350 to 1,345. May (central) saw offers at 1,330 versus bids at 1,315.
Among refined products, June RBD palm oil was offered at $555 a tonne FOB Malaysia, and July/Aug/Sep at $545. June was traded at $552.50 and July at $545.
June RBD palm olein saw offers at $590, July at $582.50 and July/Aug/Sep at $575. June was traded from $590 to $592.50, July at $580 and $581, and July/Aug/Sep at $572.50 and $575.
May RBD palm stearin was offered at $437.50 and June at $430. May palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $290.
